com.jme3.input.controls

Interface ActionListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InputListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChaseCamera, FlyByCamera, ScreenshotAppState

    public interface ActionListener
extends InputListener
    ActionListener is used to receive input events in "digital" style.

    Generally all button inputs, such as keyboard, mouse button, and joystick button, will be represented exactly. Analog inputs will be converted into digital.

    When an action listener is registered to a natively digital input, such as a button, the event will be invoked when the button is pressed, with value set to true, and will be invoked again when the button is released, with value set to false.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAction(java.lang.String name, boolean isPressed, float tpf)
      Called when an input to which this listener is registered to is invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • onAction

        void onAction(java.lang.String name,
            boolean isPressed,
            float tpf)
        Called when an input to which this listener is registered to is invoked.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the mapping that was invoked
        isPressed - True if the action is "pressed", false otherwise
        tpf - The time per frame value.
